item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, May 20, 2025 at 8:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Making Video Games (Without an Engine) in 2025 (97 points | 31 comments)
2. I got fooled by AI-for-science hype–here's what it taught me (119 points | 62 comments)
3. Finland announces migration of its rail network to international gauge (20 points | 9 comments)
4. DDoSecrets publishes 410 GB of heap dumps, hacked from TeleMessage (398 points | 99 comments)
5. The Windows Subsystem for Linux is now open source (1295 points | 855 comments)
6. Have I Been Pwned 2.0 (529 points | 165 comments)
7. Jules: An Asynchronous Coding Agent (322 points | 133 comments)
8. What are people doing? Live-ish estimates based on global population dynamics (131 points | 48 comments)
9. Zod 4 (682 points | 201 comments)
10. Questioning Representational Optimism in Deep Learning (6 points | discuss)
11. GitHub Copilot Coding Agent (419 points | 261 comments)
12. A shower thought turned into a Collatz visualization (103 points | 15 comments)
13. Ask HN: Do people actually pay for small web tools? (34 points | 33 comments)
14. The Entropy of Thought: Why Our Minds Gravitate Toward Divided Realities (7 points | 2 comments)
15. Ann, the Small Annotation Server (35 points | 4 comments)
16. Claude Code SDK (337 points | 152 comments)
17. Solving physics-based initial value problems with unsupervised machine learning (5 points | discuss)
18. Launch HN: Better Auth (YC X25) – Authentication Framework for TypeScript (207 points | 81 comments)
19. A man who visited every country in the world without boarding a plane (2023) (51 points | 22 comments)
20. Kilo: A text editor in less than 1000 LOC with syntax highlight and search (133 points | 21 comments)
21. Run GitHub Actions locally (229 points | 94 comments)
22. Game theory illustrated by an animated cartoon game (278 points | 44 comments)
23. Memory Consistency Models: A Tutorial (38 points | 2 comments)
24. The forbidden railway: Vienna-Pyongyang (2008) (186 points | 57 comments)
25. Terraform MCP Server (74 points | 16 comments)
26. Center for AI Safety's new spokesperson suggests „burning down labs" (9 points | discuss)
27. Biff – a batteries-included web framework for Clojure (30 points | 5 comments)
28. xAI's Grok 3 comes to Microsoft Azure (133 points | 131 comments)
29. Remarks on AI from NZ (153 points | 81 comments)
30. Too Much Go Misdirection (172 points | 79 comments)
